summary: This is a U.S. Department of Justice foreign travel questionnaire for a U.S. Attorney's Office employee traveling from New York to an unspecified foreign location from February 3-6, 2020. The purpose is to interview and debrief a witness in the ongoing, sensitive investigation into Jeffrey Epstein, with Ghislaine Maxwell identified as a subject.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The case being investigated is "In re Jeffrey Epstein," referenced by USAO number 2018R01618.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Identified as a subject of the investigation, believed to be a citizen of the United States, the United Kingdom, and France.

connections.description: Both are named as subjects in the same ongoing criminal investigation (USAO # 2018R01618).

events.title: Planned Foreign Travel for Investigation
events.description: A U.S. Attorney's Office employee from SDNY is scheduled to depart for foreign travel to interview and debrief a witness in the Jeffrey Epstein investigation.

events.title: Return from Investigation Travel
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office employee is scheduled to return from foreign travel related to the Epstein investigation.

keyFacts: The document is a foreign travel authorization form for a U.S. Attorney (SDNY) traveling from February 3-6, 2020, for the purpose of interviewing/debriefing a witness in the Jeffrey Epstein case.
The case is officially referenced as "In re Jeffrey Epstein, USAO # 2018R01618" and is described as an ongoing and very sensitive investigation.
Ghislaine Maxwell is explicitly identified as a subject of the investigation, with her citizenship noted as the United States, the United Kingdom, and France.
The travel involves coordination with foreign authorities, who have cleared the visit and are prepared to cooperate.
The traveler's official passport details are listed as pending, and the security clearance level is indicated as Top Secret.
